channel.title: Question!
channel.description: Okay this is serious, I have a computer and my brother had a laptop, we had the same internet source because i got a Dsl modem and a TP- link router. I turned my server online and i sent him the client, the ip's of the client are 127.0.0.1. But the server said "error connecting to server" but i can play but my brother can't play but we got same internet source and gateway?? what will be the client ip and do i have to portforward???

item.title: Question!
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

mr pker01:

Thanks, do i need to portforward?

If you haven’t already, yes.

Read full topic

item.title: Question!
item.dc:creator: @mr_pker01 mr pker01
item.description:
@mr_pker01 wrote:

Thanks, do i need to portforward?

Read full topic

item.title: Question!
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

He will have to enter your IPv4 address, which is 192.168.#.# usually. To find it, enter “ipconfig” in command prompt.

Read full topic
